content.description: This is sort of tall. Climb crimps to the top of the vertical face.
content.location: It is on the south side of Plumb Fall Boulder.

content.description: Start with a right hand pinch on the arete at head height. Climb up to the lip where there is a tricky mantle. The sit could go!
content.protection: 3 pads and a good spot. This has back slap potential for sure.
content.location:
This boulder sits at the base of the talus 20' behind site 5. Plumb Fall faces north next to the approach up to

All Time Arete

.

content.description:
Thsi is another Gem with a unique roof / cave for the valley.

Start on hanging pinch at back of cave and climb out roof using incut crimps. Jugs at the first lip allow you to move right and climb the vertical headwall to the top.
content.location: Hike about 100 yards up the right side of the talus field then head north about 100 feet.  Look for the big roof and a large built up landing. The problem faces west.

content.description:
This is the low start to

All Time Arete

.

Start crouched on two sloper pinches at base of arete. Climb a couple hard tension moves into the

All Time Arete

stand start.
content.protection: 3+ pads.  Make sure to have a low spotter as it is easy to rocket off into the talus if you fall.

content.description: This one is another stand out for the area.  Climb the hanging arete using slopers and pinches on the arete and variety of features on the face.  Starts left hand in a good side pull right hand on slopers at shoulder height.  Rad!
content.location: About 100 ft up the talus from Plumb Fall.  Look for the hanging arete on the north end of a large boulder.
